pr_title: New virt attribute module for user certificates

timeline.bodyText: You should add @SkipValueCheckDuringDependencyCheck, otherwise attribute value will be retrieved during dependency checks and then no check will be preformed, since module doesn't have one.
timeline.author: zlamalp

timeline.bodyText: I know that this is clear and correct implementation, but we should minimize number of selects. Like retrieve both attributes at once. Also dependency on another virtual attributes is problematic. As a result, you twice retrieve value of user:def:userCertificates and then do some work with it. Maybe you should extract logic from getValue() of user:def:userCertificates and make it ModulesUtilsBlImpl method. Then you could use it directly in both modules to select user attributes only once and construct expiration mapping locally in this module (without dependency on virtual attribute).
timeline.author: zlamalp

timeline.message:
New virt attribute module for user certificates

-Attribute module urn_perun_user_attribute_def_virt_userCertificates was created
 for MUNI purposes. They need to get only the 10 newest user certificates. So the module
 takes all user certificates and return only the 10 newest according to
 certificate expirations.
-For the purpose of this attribute and the attribute
 user:virt:userCertExpirations was created method
 retrieveCertsExpiration, which extracts expiration for all user
 certificates and return them as a map.

New virt attribute module for user certificates

-Attribute module urn_perun_user_attribute_def_virt_userCertificates was created
 for MUNI purposes. They need to get only the 10 newest user certificates. So the module

-For the purpose of this attribute and the attribute

 retrieveCertsExpiration, which extracts expiration for all user
 certificates and return them as a map.

timeline.bodyText: You should test not-null on certificate variable.
timeline.author: stavamichal

timeline.bodyText:
You can call this instead:
.forEachOrdered(entry -> result.add(certs.get(entry.getKey())));
timeline.author: stavamichal

timeline.bodyText: We should think about the name. This is too simple and it will be hard to understand that this specific certificate attribute is limited by 10 last certificates. I would prefer something like userCertificatesLimited or something similar to that. In the future, the limit itself could be attribute of facility and '10' could be the default value.
timeline.author: stavamichal

replies.bodyText: Please fix attribute name also in commit message. Thank you.
replies.author: zlamalp

timeline.bodyText: You need to change content of this method too (while changing the name).
timeline.author: stavamichal
